page.title: 14Health
page.content: Cheddleton is still without a resident doctor. Surgeries are held twice a week in St.Andrews Church and a doctor attends the clinic from Leek. Leek or Cheedle provide dentists and opticians. In 1903 CPC were asking a doctor to live in their parish. Years ago families were much in the hands of doctors who visited from leek, tales are told of the generosity of these doctors who waved fees after attending mothers giving birth to their children and seeing some of the children off to the fever-hospital. With the coming of the NHS in 1946 this burden was lifted from the family and in oculations have largely reduced serious children illnesses. Now that mental illness is more widely accepted, patients are treated in the community,and St. Edwards Hospital faces closure before the end of the century.
